byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Aurelien Breeden, Lilia Blaise, Elian Peltier and Marlise Simons from Paris; Helene Cooper and Michael D. Shear from Washington; and Rick Gladstone from New York.

abstract: American service members Spencer Stone and Alek Skarlatos tackle and detain suspected terrorist who entered high-speed train traveling from Amsterdam to Paris carrying AK-47 and handgun; Stone is severely cut by suspect, identified only as a 26-year-old man of Moroccan origin, and is receiving treatment at hospital; France's top antiterrorism investigators are trying to sort out sequence of events.
lead_paragraph: The two men averted carnage by tackling an armed, suspected terrorist on a high-speed train traveling from Amsterdam to France, officials said.

headline.main: 2 American Service Members Foil Gunman in Train Attack
headline.print_headline: 2 American Service Members Foil Gunman in Train Attack

snippet: The two men averted carnage by tackling an armed, suspected terrorist on a high-speed train traveling from Amsterdam to France, officials said.
